S.I. No. 305 of 2024 

CONTROL OF SALMONELLA REGULATIONS 2024 

I, CHARLIE MCCONALOGUE, Minister for Agriculture, Food and the 
Marine, in exercise of the powers conferred on me by sections 36 and 36A 
(inserted by the Greyhound Racing Act 2019 (No. 15 of 2019)) of the Animal 
Health and Welfare Act 2013 (No. 15 of 2013) and so far as it relates to 
Regulation 11 of these Regulations, section 3 of the European Communities Act 
1972 (No. 27 of 1972), and for the purpose of giving full effect to Regulation 
2160/2003 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 17 November, 
20031, Commission Regulation 200/2010 of 10 March 20102, Commission 
Regulation 200/2012 of 8 March 20123, Commission Regulation 1190/2012 of 
12 December 20124 and Commission Regulation 517/2011 of 25 May 20115, 
make the following regulations:

title: CONTROL OF SALMONELLA REGULATIONS 2024
heading: 1. These are the Control of Salmonella Regulations 2024.
text_raw:
1. These are the Control of Salmonella Regulations 2024. 

Interpretation

title: CONTROL OF SALMONELLA REGULATIONS 2024
heading: 2. (1) In these Regulations—
text_raw:
2. (1) In these Regulations— 

“Act” means Animal Health and Welfare Act 2013; 

“flock” means all poultry of the same health status kept on the same premises or 
in the same enclosure and constituting a single epidemiological unit. In housed 
poultry this will include all birds sharing the same airspace; 

“holder” in relation to a laboratory approval includes a person employed by the 
holder; 

“Salmonella” means– 

(a) 

(b) 

in the case of broiler breeding flocks, Salmonella Enteritidis, 
Salmonella Typhimurium, including monophasic Salmonella 
Typhimurium, Salmonella Hadar, Salmonella Infantis, or 
Salmonella Virchow, o 

in the case of broiler flocks (other than breeding flocks), rearing 
flocks, laying flocks, turkey fattening flocks or turkey breeding 
flocks, Salmonella Enteritidis or Salmonella Typhimurium, 
including monophasic Salmonella Typhimurium. 

(2) A word or expression that is used in an act of the institutions of the 
European Union cited in Regulation 5 of these Regulations and that is also used

title: CONTROL OF SALMONELLA REGULATIONS 2024
heading: 3. These regulations do not apply to–
text_raw:
3. These regulations do not apply to– 

(a) 

(b) 

(c) 

a primary producer engaged in the direct supply of eggs from a 
flock of hens not exceeding 50 birds, to a final consumer or retail 
establishments directly supplying the final consumer, located no 
more than 100 kilometres from the flock, 

a primary producer engaged in the slaughter on the premises of 
no more than 1,000 broilers in any week and no more than 10,000 
in any year, that are supplied to the final consumer or to a retail 
establishment supplying the meat directly to the final consumer, 
located no more than 100 kilometres from the flock, 

a primary producer engaged in the slaughter on the premises of 
no more than 100 turkeys in any week and no more than 1,000 in 
any year, and that are supplied to the final consumer or to a retail 
establishment supplying the meat directly to the final consumer, 
located no more than 100 kilometres from the flock, or 

(d) 

a broiler breeding or turkey breeding flock not exceeding 250 
birds. 

Samples

title: CONTROL OF SALMONELLA REGULATIONS 2024
heading: 4. The owner or person in charge of a flock shall ensure that—
text_raw:
4. The owner or person in charge of a flock shall ensure that— 

(a) 

samples are taken at the land or premises on which the flock is 
kept, and 

(b) 

each sample and each record relating to it is dealt with, 

in accordance with Regulation 5. 

Sampling framework

text_raw:

(b) 

(c)

the Annex to Commission Regulation 517/2011 of 25 May 2011, 

the Annex to Commission Regulation 1190/2012 of 12 December 
2012, or, as the case may be, 

(e) 

the Annex to Commission Regulation 200/2012 of 8 March 2012.

title: CONTROL OF SALMONELLA REGULATIONS 2024
heading: 6. (1) A person shall not operate a laboratory for the purposes of these
text_raw:
6. (1) A person shall not operate a laboratory for the purposes of these 
Regulations, or an act of the institutions of the European Union mentioned in 
Regulation 5, other than in accordance with an approval granted by the Minister 
(“laboratory approval”). 

(2) An application for laboratory approval shall be made in a form and 

contain any information that the Minister may require. 

(3) The Minister shall not consider an application for laboratory approval 
unless the application contains all the material and particulars sought and is 
accompanied by the fee (if any) set in accordance with section 73 of the Act. 

(4) The holder of a laboratory approval shall make such returns to the 

Minister as the Minister may require. 

(5) The Minister may issue a laboratory approval, revoke, or suspend a 

laboratory approval, attach conditions to an approval or refuse an application. 

(6) Without prejudice to the generality of paragraph (6), a condition to a 

laboratory approval may relate to– 

(a) methods and standards of analysis, 

(b) 

security and integrity of samples during transport, storage, and 
analysis, 

(c) 

the maintenance, form, and content of records, and 

(d) 

reports to be made to the Minister. 

(7) If the Minister proposes to revoke or suspend a laboratory approval or 

refuse an application, he or she shall— 

(a) 

(b) 

(c) 

notify the holder of a laboratory approval or applicant in writing 
of the proposal and of the reasons for the proposal, and that he or 
she may make representations to the Minister in relation to the 
proposal within 14 days of the notification, 

consider any representations duly made before deciding whether 
to proceed with, modify or annul the proposal, and 

notify the holder of a laboratory approval or applicant of the 
decision and the reasons for the decision. 

(8) If the Minister is of the opinion that it is necessary for the protection of 
human or animal health, he or she may suspend or revoke an approval in 
accordance with paragraph (9). 

(9) If the Minister proposes to revoke or suspend a laboratory approval or 
refuse an application for a purpose mentioned in paragraph (8), he or she shall— 

(a) 

notify the holder of a laboratory approval in writing of the 
decision and of the reasons for the decision, and that he or she 
may make representations to the Minister in relation to the 
decision within 14 days of the notification, 

(b) 

consider any representations duly made before deciding whether 
to affirm, modify or annul the decision, and 

 
 6 [305] 

(c) 

notify the holder of a laboratory approval or applicant of the 
decision and the reasons for the decision. 

(10) If the Minister grants a laboratory approval, he or she may specify a 

date on which that approval expires. 

(11) A laboratory approval granted under the Regulations revoked by 
Regulation 13 that is in force immediately before the commencement of these 
Regulations remains in force and may be dealt with as if granted under these 
Regulations. 

Obligations of laboratories

title: CONTROL OF SALMONELLA REGULATIONS 2024
heading: 7. (1) The holder of a laboratory approval in respect of a laboratory to which
text_raw:
7. (1) The holder of a laboratory approval in respect of a laboratory to which 

a sample is submitted shall ensure that— 

(a) 

(b) 

(c) 

the sample is tested as soon as practicable for the presence of 
Salmonella in accordance with a method approved by the 
Minister, 

the result of the test is reported in writing as soon as practicable 
to the person who submitted the sample, and 

if Salmonella is detected, the Minister is immediately informed 
of the result followed by written confirmation within 24 hours. 

(2) The holder of a laboratory approval shall— 

(a) 

(b) 

(c) 

apply quality control systems that conform to the current EN/ISO 
standard, 

regularly participate in collaborative testing organised or 
coordinated by the National Reference Laboratory, and 

comply with all conditions applicable to the laboratory as notified 
to the holder of the laboratory approval by the Minister at the time 
of approval or subsequently. 

Control measures
text_norm: 7 (1) holder laboratory approval respect laboratory sample submitted shall ensure that-- (a) (b) (c) sample tested soon practicable presence salmonella accordance method approved minister result test reported writing soon practicable person submitted sample salmonella detected minister immediately informed result followed written confirmation within 24 hour (2) holder laboratory approval shall-- (a) (b) (c) apply quality control system conform current en iso standard regularly participate collaborative testing organised coordinated national reference laboratory comply condition applicable laboratory notified holder laboratory approval minister time approval subsequently control measure

title: CONTROL OF SALMONELLA REGULATIONS 2024
heading: 8. (1) If Salmonella is detected in a flock, the owner or person in charge shall
text_raw:
8. (1) If Salmonella is detected in a flock, the owner or person in charge shall 
not move, or cause or permit another person to move eggs, poultry or poultry 
meat from the land or premises where the eggs, poultry or poultry meat is located 
without the consent in writing of an authorised officer. 

(2) A person shall not have a thing that has been moved in contravention of 

this paragraph in his or her possession or under his or her control. 

(3) If Salmonella is detected in a flock, the owner or person in charge shall 
take all necessary steps to ensure that all non-incubated eggs are destroyed or 
treated in a manner that guarantees the elimination of Salmonella, and in the case 
of breeding flocks of Gallus gallus or turkeys, all birds in the flock are 
slaughtered. 

(4) If Salmonella is detected in a flock, the owner or person in charge shall 
take all necessary steps to ensure that all hatching eggs are destroyed or treated, 

 
 
 
 [305] 7 

a product derived from poultry referred to in paragraph (1) which are not 
destined for human consumption are used or disposed of in accordance with 
Regulation (EU) 1609/2009 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 
21 October 2009. 

(5) If an authorised officer consents in accordance with paragraph (1), the 
authorised officer may specify the place or manner in which the birds should be 
slaughtered or destroyed or the manner in which eggs should be destroyed or 
treated and nobody shall deal with the birds or eggs except in accordance with 
such specification. 

(6) If birds, products, or eggs are destroyed and disposed of under this 
Regulation, the owner or person in charge shall ensure that the land and premises 
concerned is cleansed and disinfected, including safe disposal of manure and 
litter, in accordance with procedures (if any) laid down by an authorised officer. 

(7) A person shall not restock land or premises referred to in paragraph (3) 
and (4) unless an authorised officer certifies in writing that he or she is satisfied 
that all reasonable precautions have been taken to ensure the elimination of 
Salmonella. 

Records

title: CONTROL OF SALMONELLA REGULATIONS 2024
heading: 9. The owner or person in charge of a flock shall keep, and retain for a
text_raw:
9. The owner or person in charge of a flock shall keep, and retain for a 
period of at least three years, a record of the movement of birds and eggs, 
including— 

(a) 

the date of the movement, 

(b) 

the number of birds, or eggs moved, 

(c) 

the identity of the building or group of buildings into which or 
from which the birds or eggs were moved, 

(d) name and address of the land or premises from which incoming 

birds and eggs were brought, and 

(e) 

name and address of the land or premises to which out-going birds 
and eggs were sent. 

Tampering with sample, etc.
text_norm: 9 owner person charge flock shall keep retain period least three year record movement bird egg including-- (a) date movement (b) number bird egg moved (c) identity building group building bird egg moved (d) name address land premise incoming bird egg brought (e) name address land premise out-going bird egg sent tampering sample etc

title: CONTROL OF SALMONELLA REGULATIONS 2024
heading: 10. (1) A person shall not—
text_raw:
10. (1) A person shall not— 

(a) 

(b) 

tamper or otherwise interfere with any sample taken for the 
purposes of these Regulations or an act of the institutions of the 
European Union mentioned in Regulation 5, 

tamper or otherwise interfere with any poultry, poultry meat or 
eggs so as to procure that any sample of it taken for the purposes 
of these Regulations or an act of the institutions of the European 
Union mentioned in Regulation 5, does not correctly represent the 
poultry, poultry meat or eggs, or the produce from which the 
sample was derived, 

 
 
 
 8 [305] 

(c) 

treat or allow treatment of any bird which causes any sample to 
be invalid. 

Penal Provisions

heading: 11. Regulations 6 (1), (4), 7, 8, 9 and 10, are penal provisions to which
text_raw:

section 36(4)(b) of the Act applies. 

Contravention of EU Regulation

title: CONTROL OF SALMONELLA REGULATIONS 2024
heading: 12. A contravention of, or failure to comply with a provision of an act of the
text_raw:
12. A contravention of, or failure to comply with a provision of an act of the 
institutions of the European Union mentioned in Regulation 5 is a breach to 
which section 36A (inserted by the Greyhound Racing Act 2019) of the Act 
applies. 

Revocations

text_raw:
13. The following are revoked: 

(a) 

(b) 

(c) 

(d) 

the European Communities (Control of Salmonella in breeding 
Flocks of Domestic Fowl) Regulations 2006 (S.I. No. 706 of 
2006), 

the European Communities (Control of Salmonella in Laying

CHARLIE MCCONALOGUE,

title: CONTROL OF SALMONELLA REGULATIONS 2024
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [305] 9 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These Regulations give effect to EU legislation on the control of Salmonella in 
broiler breeding flocks, broiler flocks, rearing flocks, laying flocks, turkey 
fattening flocks and turkey breeding flocks. 

 
 
 
 10 [305]
